references.paper_title: Photorealistic text-to-image diffusion models with deep language understanding
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of text-to-image generation, introducing a model that achieves high-quality image generation from text prompts, directly relevant to the core topic of the subject paper.

references.paper_title: Dreambooth: Fine tuning text-to-image diffusion models for subject-driven generation
references.reason: This paper details a method for personalizing text-to-image models, which is highly relevant to the subject paper's discussion of unauthorized usage of personal data in training and fine-tuning.

references.paper_title: Protecting artists from style mimicry by {Text-to-Image} models
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the issue of copyright protection in the context of text-to-image models, proposing a method to prevent unauthorized style mimicry, a key concern that the subject paper also tackles.

references.paper_title: Alteration-free and model-agnostic origin attribution of generated images
references.reason: This paper provides a technique for determining the origin of generated images, which is relevant to the subject paper's focus on detecting unauthorized dataset usage in text-to-image models.

references.paper_title: Steal my artworks for fine-tuning? a watermarking framework for detecting art theft mimicry in text-to-image models
references.reason: This paper introduces a watermarking scheme for protecting dataset copyright, a similar approach to what the subject paper explores, but using a different technique.
